BtLeFindMe.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Lost Keys Finder application
BtLeFindMe.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to use selected BlackBerry 10 Bluetooth Low Energy APIs in the context of a practical real-world use case.

The use case examines how to interface to a Bluetooth Low Energy device that will, on demand, issue alerts in the form of audible beeps and flashing LEDs. Think of a key fob that that can be activated from your BlackBerry 10 device to allow it to be found again easily.

The application uses the standard Find Me Profile (overview available here) as specified by the Bluetooth SIG enabling it to interwork with any Bluetooth Smart device that implements this profile.

bucketlist.note:
How to use the MultiSelectHandler on a list.

Also shows how to load and save data from a JSON file

calendar.desc: How to implement at simple calendar application

callapizza.desc: Call A Pizza demonstrates how to invoke the phone application with a pre-selected number

CalendarListener(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to receive an Appointment Event Objet

camera.desc: Demonstrates the HTML5 Camera API and xhr2 uploading
camera.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

canvasToFilesystem.desc: Sample implementation of saving <canvas> contents to the BlackBerry 10 filesystem.

GoodCitizen.desc: Introduction to a number of common development practices
GoodCitizen.note:
Showcases lighting, textures, orientation and touch events, swipe downs, saving application state, clean termination, etc

There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

GoodCitizenCascades.desc: The Cascades version of the NDK Sample App named 'Good Citizen'
GoodCitizenCascades.note:
This sample features best practices on how to properly structure the Open GL code and link it with Cascades.

The sample shows how to leverage Actions and the use of NavigatorPanes for multiple panels, as well as how to process touch events and use them to control a 3D scene rendered in OpenGL, using Qt objects and JavaScript

gseCrypto(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BlackBerry 10 extension to access cryptographic API

HeartMonitor.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate Monitor application
HeartMonitor.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to use selected BlackBerry 10 Bluetooth Low Energy APIs in the context of a practical real-world use case.

The use case examines how to interface to a Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate Monitor device in order to acquire and display data from the device. The application uses the standard Heart Rate Service as specificied by the Bluetooth SIG enabling it to interwork with any Bluetooth Smart device that implements this profile.

HelloCamera.desc: Sets up a Cascades foreign window and connects a Camera Viewfinder to it
HelloCamera.note:
HelloCamera is a slender little app showing how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

It has functionality for starting and stopping the camera service, changing between cameras and take photos that saves to the camera album

hellocascades.desc: Very basic Hello World in Cascades

helloforeignwindow.desc: Introduction to using the ForeignWindow API

HelloOggVorbis.desc: Basic Ogg file handling using OpenAL and Ogg Vorbis
HelloOggVorbis.note:
This sample is extended from the original cascades cowbell sample in the Cascades-Samples repository.

The objective of this sample is to serve as a tutorial for setting up OpenAL and OggVorbis SDK to play compressed .ogg vorbis sound format. The sample also shows how to decode the regular .wav files without ALUT

HelloVideoCamera.desc: A minimalist Cascades-based video camera app
HelloVideoCamera.note:
HelloVideoCamera is a minimalist Cascades-based video camera app. It illustrates how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

HelloVideoCamera has functionality for starting and sotpping the camera, changing between front and back cameras, and recording video files which are saved to the camera roll.

HelloSceneCover.note: HelloSceneCover is a minimalist Cascades-based app. It illustrates how to set up an Application Cover (viewable in Active Frames) for when the application is minimised.

HelloWorld.desc: Simple WebWorks application; uses Location API

NativeCamera.desc: A simple picture-taking app in C/C++ without Cascades
NativeCamera.note:
The sample shows:
  • how to access the camera
  • how to start the viewfinder and acquire the corresponding viewfinder window handle
  • how to take a photo (non-blocking)
  • how to save a photo to the camera roll
  • how to pass argument data between the main thread and your callback threads
  • how to signal your main thread using user-defined bps events from your callback thread

ndefTagReading.desc: This library allows WebWorks to handle tag reading in pure JavaScript. No extensions are required - tags are delivered through the Invocation Framework.

NetworkStatus.desc: How to retrieve the network status of the device
NetworkStatus.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

nfcdemo.desc: Shows how to exchange content, such as messages or files, with another NFC enabled device, or just how to read NFC tags

NfcMidlet2.desc: MIDlet that can receive HCI transaction notifications relating NFC card emulation activity
NfcMidlet2.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcReadNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to receive NDEF messages from tags and how to process them
NfcReadNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcSharing.desc: Sharing Data and Files using NFC and Bluetooth
NfcSharing.note: focusses on those that allow you to share data and files either directly using NFC or using NFC to negotiate a Bluetooth connection which is then used to transfer the data as defined by the NFC Forum Connection Handover standard.

NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to write various sorts of NDEF messages to NFC tags
NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcVirtualTargetFun.desc: Shows the emulation and reading of NFC virtual tags
NfcVirtualTargetFun.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcSnepResponder.desc: Shows how to transfer NDEF messages between NFC-enabled BlackBerry smartphones using the Simple NDEF Exchange Protocol (SNEP)
NfcSnepResponder.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcToolLite.desc: How to use selected BlackBerry 10 NFC APIs, focusing on the Invocation Framework
NfcToolLite.note: Focuses on those NFC APIs that make use of the Invocation Framework allowing many NFC interactions to take place using QML rather than C/C++

NfcTool.desc: Shows how to use selected BlackBerry 10 NFC APIs
NfcTool.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags
  • Writing NDEF tags
  • Transfer vCard via SNEP

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcTransactionHandler.desc: Shows key aspects of an application working in NFC card emulation mode
NfcTransactionHandler.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcRaceTime7.desc: Start/stop watch demo app which shows how to integrate NFC Tags into your BlackBerry 7 application. Partner to NfcRaceTimeWay for BlackBerry 10.
NfcRaceTime7.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcRaceTimeWay.desc: Shows how to integrate NFC Tags and Virtual Tag Emulation into your BlackBerry 10 application. Partner to NfcRaceTime7 for BlackBerry 7.
NfcRaceTimeWay.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags
  • Virtual tag emulation

Also see the NFC Wiki page

pageddatamodel.desc: How to create a list view by QML and add items dynamically

PasswordSample.desc: How to use some of  the Blackberry 10 security APIs
PasswordSample.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how the BlackBerry 10 Security Builder API together with standard features of Qt and Cascades might be used to implement a basic user ID and password based login screen whilst allowing the user credentials to be stored safely locally (as in this case) or remotely using one-way encryption of the password rendering it unusable to those with access to the credentials store.

Payment.desc: Shows how to use the BlackBerry Payment service from a BlackBerry WebWorks App

PaymentService.desc: How to support purchase requests in your application using the Payment Service
PaymentService.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

paymentservice(Cascades).desc: Demonstrates how to use the Payment Service APIs
paymentservice(Cascades).note: Shows how add features like a 'Buy' button and how to display purchase history and subscription terms.  Also shows several layouts and load data into a list using XmlDataModel

PeaksAndValleys.desc: Show how to navigate through a landscape using WebGL
PeaksAndValleys.note:
Sample showcases rendering, textures, lighting, skybox and terrain generation and more

This game runs on the BlackBerry PlayBook and BlackBerry 10 as well as on desktop browsers.

There is no online version yet (unlike TunnelTilt)

persistentobjects.desc: How to create/load/write/update a persistent object

photobomber.note: How to use the Cascades multimedia library with the Camera, take a picture, manipulate the image to be grayscale, and add an image over another image

PhotoEditor(AIR,bb10).desc: Shows how to create and interact with Composer, Previewer, and Picker Cards

PhotoViewer(AIR,bb10).desc: Uses a custom Viewer to display a random image from the shared camera folder

PictureWall.desc: Control a collection of BlackBerry PlayBooks to display one or more images
PictureWall.note:
Uses socket.io on the client and nodeJS on the server

Should run on BB10

pimcalendar.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of PIM Calendar APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

pimcontacts.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of PIM Contact APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

PjsipDemo.desc: Demonstration of how to build, include and use PJSIP in a Cascades project
PjsipDemo.note:
Currently a very simple application but contains bash scripts for building PJSIP for BB10

Building PJSIP has to be done on Linux/Mac but the resulting files can be overlayed on the SDK of any platform

placepicker.desc: How to use the PlacePicker class to select a place from the favorites list, map lookup or an online search

PlayAudio.desc: How to play an MP3 file
PlayAudio.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

PlayWav.desc: How to play a WAV file
PlayWav.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

poemmaker.note:
The Poem Maker is a simple application with three lines of text (labels) and a button. Clicking the button will generate a random 'refrigerator' poem

Among others, the application shows how to use JavaScript functions in QML

PreventSleep(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension to prevent the screen from sleeping

Psychic8.desc: Magic 8 Ball® BBM Integration and Shake To Update sample.

PullDownToRefresh.desc: A standard way to implement pull down to refresh in browser/WebWorks applications in BlackBerry 10 Applications
PullDownToRefresh.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

pullmybeard.note:
This sample application illustrates how to set up a very basic touch interaction.

This is illustrated by moving an image in response to a touch event, and animating it back to position when the touch ends

pushCapture.desc: Demonstrates how to write a BlackBerry 10 WebWorks Application that can receive push events
pushCapture.note: Consult the PushService and PushPayload classes from the API reference for useful examples and a full description of how to use the push APIs

pushCollector.desc: How to listen to incoming push requests and display the delivered data

PushSampleApp(AIR,bb10).desc: A BlackBerry 10 Adobe AIR App that can receive Push Events

quotes.note: Shows how to deal with dynamic data in a list that is stored in a SQL database

repeater.note:
How to use QDeclarativeComponent to add a custom element

Load and unload controls from external QML file or internal component

RestaurantLocator.desc: How to make a semi-complex list with rich formatting using jQuery Mobile
RestaurantLocator.note: Samples are intended to be included in the jQuery Mobile Cookbook

RockPaperScissors.desc: Simple Rock Paper Scissors game using Cascasdes

RotateText.desc: Draw text at any angle using OpenGL 2.0
RotateText.note: The sample shows how to draw text at any angle using OpenGL 2.0 and pure C

RotationCamera.desc: A demonstration of how to handle camera rotation
RotationCamera.note: RotationCamera is a modified version of HelloVideoCamera with the added capability of being able to handle navigator orientation events. Care is given to illustrate how to handle reorienting the camera images whether using the front or rear-facing camera, and whether recording video or simply displaying the viewfinder. Future platform capabilities are also accounted for in this code, so it should be relatively future-proof. This is a tricky topic, so there is plenty of in-line documentation both in the code, and in the readme.

routemapinvoker.desc: How to invoke the map application and configure it to show a certain route between two locations

rssnews.desc: How to load JSON and XML data from the network and then visualize it

SampleApplication(AIR,pb).desc: An App that uses the Adobe AIR SDK for PlayBook and the SampleLibrary

SampleBPSANE(AIR,ext,bb10).desc: A Sample AIR Native Extension using the BPS system that uses the Azimuth Pitch and Roll sensor

SampleBPSANE(AIR,ext,pb).desc: A Sample AIR Native Extension using the BPS system that uses the Azimuth Pitch and Roll sensor

SampleBwsClient(C#).desc: A C# program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SampleBwsClient(Java).desc: A Java program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SampleLibrary(AIR,pb).desc: Several component samples for the Adobe AIR SDK for PlayBook
SampleLibrary(AIR,pb).note:
Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

Samples include Navigation Menu, Search, Download Manager, Media Playbar, Screen Animations, Cache, Scrolling Margee, Back button

ScoreloopIntegrationSample.desc: Integration of Scoreloop with the BPS event system
ScoreloopIntegrationSample.note: Two variations, with Makefile and Managed by IDE, showing integration of Scoreloop with a native App

scoreloopintegrationsample(Cascades).desc: Integration of Scoreloop with the BPS event system for Cascades Applications
scoreloopintegrationsample(Cascades).note: Variant to use for Applications written using the Cascades framework

scratchpad.desc: How to use QImage and QPainter to prepare a cascades::Image
scratchpad.note: For more details, refer to the companion KB Article

Screen(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to subscribe to srolling events, set title and show/hide virtual keyboard

ScreenTemplate.desc: Template you can use to set your application to start using the BPS infrastructure
ScreenTemplate.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PLayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

SendMenu(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to expose the Send/Share Menu API

SensorDemo.desc: A collection of pages demonstrating how to retrieve and process data from hardware sensors

Sensors.desc: Using several sensors in a BlackBerry WebWorks application, and displaying data back to user
Sensors.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

SetWallpaper.desc: How to set the wallpaper in a BlackBerry 10 device using WebWorks

shareCard.desc: Implementing a Share Target (aka. Share Card) using BlackBerry WebWorks

ShareFile.desc: How to use the Share a File from QML

ShareTargets.desc: Shows how to invoke Share Targets (aka. Share Cards) in BlackBerry WebWorks

SimpleLocationAPI.desc: Simplified version of the Location API packages for the Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones
SimpleLocationAPI.note: Note the whitespace embedded in the URL!

SimplePushClient.desc: A simplified push client that also integrates with the device notifications and application thumbnail view.

SimplePushServer.desc: A simple push server that runs on BlackBerry 10. Test both sides of push from the same device!

simplemap.desc: How to display a location on a map control

SketchPad.desc: Shows how to use touch events and HTML5 Canvas in a BlackBerry WebWorks App

Sleep(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to suspend and enable the backlight

Sleep(pb,ext).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to suspend changing the system IdleMode property

SmartSignals.desc: Handle C-Level BPS events in the Cascades Framework
SmartSignals.note: Written using Beta 3. This sample shows how the AbstractBpsEventHandler interface can be extended to receive BPS events without needing to create a separate thread. These events are then made accessible to the QML layer by creating and registering a C++ class, BPSMonitor, so it is known to QML

ScrollableLists.desc: A UI that scrolls horizontally in Cascades

soapxml.desc: How to access a SOAP service using QTSoap, and how to handle the XML Response

socialinvocation.desc: The Social Invocation example demonstrates how to integrate your application with various social networks through the BB10 platform

SocialApp.desc: Shows integration with Social Apps like FaceBook, Twitter, etc

speedwriter.note:
Shows how to create a Custom Control in C++ and add it to a QML document.

Also shows how to monitor changes in a TextField and update a TextArea

SpinnerControl(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to allow a more usable interface with SELECT elements in browser

stampcollector.desc: List with JSON and XML data
stampcollector.note: How to create a simple list and trigger changes in the UI on selection

starshipsettings.desc: Demonstrates how to use persistent store
starshipsettings.note: A simple control panel using QSettings API for persistent store

starshipsettings(AIR,bb10).desc: A port of the StarshipSettings application from Cascades to Adobe AIR

Storage(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to make use of the persistent storage on the device

Stumper.MakeThis!.desc: The Post-It solution from Brian Scheirer

Stumper.Carousel.desc: A Carousel (there were two similar challenges)

Stumper.HideExpose.desc: Challenge from @pbillings512: hide/expose information in areas

Stumper.Graph.desc: Challenge to create a graph from data

SwipeMenu(pb).desc: A swipe-down menu framwork for BlacKBerry WebWorks on PlayBook

SwipeMenu(bb10).desc: A swipe-down menu framework for BlackBerry WebWorks
SwipeMenu(bb10).note: Sample application that demonstrates swipemenu.js: A swipe-down menu framework for BlackBerry WebWorks SDK

Swipe-Navigation.desc: How to use gestures to navigate different pages in a WebWorks app

SystemAPIs.desc: Examples of BlackBerry System APIs from the developer microsite

SystemLog(pb,ext).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to write to the BlackBerry System Event Log

SystemLog(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to write to the BlackBerry System Event Log

systemsound.desc: How to use play one of the predefined sounds to notify the user of a certain event

TabAppMenu.desc: Cascades app menu - Shows correct usage of following Cascades components together: TabbedPane, Tab, Application Menu, Sheet, NavigationPane
TabAppMenu.note:
This is a simple Cascades sample app for developers only.
 The purpose of this app is to demonstrate how to correctly use the following Cascades components together in one app: TabbedPane, Tab, Application Menu, Sheet, NavigationPane.
 This github sample app is also accompanied by the devblog post here: http://devblog.blackberry.com/2013/03/blackberry-10-app-menu/

Thumbnail(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension for creating Image Thumbnails

tldr.desc: (Too Long; Didn't Read) How to download images from the web in an RSS reader

Toast.desc: How to integrate Toast messages into a BlackBerry WebWorks application for BlackBerry 10
Toast.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

Toe-Tac-Tic.desc: A JQuery Mobile Tic Tac Toe game.

tossgame.desc: How to use QtSensors to read values from the proximity sensor

TouchTicTacTen.desc: Peer to peer, NFC-enabled, game of Tic-Tac-Toe for BlackBerry 10
TouchTicTacTen.note:
For BlackBerry-10 based devices

Also see the TouchTicTacToe game for Java-based Devices and the NFC Wiki page

TouchTicTacToe.desc: Peer to peer, NFC-enabled, game of Tic-Tac-Toe for java-based BlackBerry Smartphones
TouchTicTacToe.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the TouchTicTacTen game for BlackBerry 10 devices and the NFC Wiki page

Titlebar.desc: Titlebar API for BlackBerry OS 4.2.1 and above
Titlebar.note: Note there is a TitleBar API for BlackBerry OS 6.0 and above

ToneGenerator.desc: A fun demo that demonstrates how to add low-latency audio generation and playback to your native application using the QNX Audio Library APIs in the BlackBerry 10 Native SDK

TransportCoverage(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to check availability and coverage of a specic transport

TunnelTilt.desc: Demonstrates how to use WebGL and how to package it using WebWorks
TunnelTilt.note:
A playable race-the-tunnel game that runs on the BlackBerry PlayBook and BlackBerry 10 as well as on desktop browsers.

Usually packaged into a WebWorks App but for a browser experience, visit here

twittertimeline.desc: Accesses the Twitter RESTful service an duses the JSON responde to display a list of tweets on screen

Twitter-OAuth-1.desc: Integrate Twitter and the OAuth 1.0 protocol into a BlackBerry WebWorks application for BlackBerry 10

UIExamples.desc: Shows how to replicated some common types of BlackBerry UI concepts.  Use bbUI.js instead
UIExamples.warning: This is obsolete; use bbUI.js instead

Unzip(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension for unzipping files

UploadDownload(pb,ext).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to upload and download files from/to server

Upload-To-YouTube.desc: A BBM Integrated Sample demonstrating invoking the BlackBerry File Picker and YouTube Video Upload.

UrbanAirshipClient.desc: The UrbanAirship sample client application for BlackBerry 10 written using the Cascades framework

vegetablesdatamodel.desc: Sample code for 'Using your own DataModel'

Vibrate(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to control the device vibration

Vibration.desc: WebWorks BB10 Smartphone extension to control the device vibration

Video-Camera.desc: Invoke the PlayBook Video Camera; close an app.

VideoPlayback.desc: How to use the multimedia capabilities of the native SDK
VideoPlayback.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

VideoPlayerSample.desc: A simple video player application that uses the MediaPlayer API
VideoPlayerSample.note: VideoPlayerSample is a simple video player application. It uses the new MediaPlayer API and showcases all the fundamentals to make other full fledged video player applications.

VideoWindow.desc: How to use the multimedia capabilities of the native SDK in concert with OpenGL ES 2.0
VideoWindow.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Weather.desc: Shows how to use the HTML5 Database and the GeoLocation APIs

weatherguesser.desc: Uses tabbed and navigation panes and loads data from SQL and nonlocal JSON feeds
weatherguesser.note: Shows how to use NavigationPane and TabbedPane, and how to populate a list using GroupDataModel and JSON and SQL

weatherguesser(AIR,bb10).desc: A port of the WeatherGuesser application from Cascades to Adobe AIR

WebWorks-Testing.desc: An on-device HTML/JS/CSS code viewer for testing WebWorks apps without compiling them.

webmapview.desc: Lets the user browse maps from different providers (Google, Bing and OpenLayers).

WindowCovers.desc: How to integrate Window Covers into a BlackBerry WebWorks application for BlackBerry 10
WindowCovers.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

YouTubeClient.desc: How to use the Communication API in BlackBerry 6.0 with YouTube Data API
YouTubeClient.note: Note the white space in the URL

ExpandableSample.desc: ExpandableSample is a little app showing how to implement custom components to replicate known UI components.

LocalizationSample.desc: How to localize your WebWorks applicaiton on BlackBerry 10
